contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whose names they had recorded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who were recorded by name

contextId.quote: So all the men of Israel ... were counted in each of their families

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Moses and Aaron did not count the men who were descended from Levi" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the men who were descended from Levi were not counted

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "When it is time to set up the tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When the tabernacle is to be set up

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Any stranger ... must die" or "You must kill any stranger who comes near the tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Any stranger ... must be killed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form AT: "the priests whom Moses anointed and ordained" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the priests who were anointed and who were ordained

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I have given them entirely" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: They are wholly given

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "you must kill any foreigner who comes near" or "any foreigner who comes near must die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: any foreigner who comes near must be put to death

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "Moses counted 8,600 males" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: 8,600 males have been counted

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "You must kill any foreigner who approaches the sanctuary" or "Any foreigner who approaches the sanctuary must die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Any foreigner who approaches the sanctuary must be put to death

contextId.information: Here "Yahweh's word" refers to Yahweh who spoke to Moses. Also, this can be stated in active form.  AT: "that Yahweh had told him to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: he was told to do by Yahweh's word

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "that I have specially selected for myself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: reserved for me

contextId.information: This phrase refers to the death of the Kohathites. This can be stated in active form. AT: "to do anything that will cause me to completely remove them from among the Levites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]]) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: to be removed from among the Levites

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom Moses and Aaron counted by their clans" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: counted by their clans

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "Moses and Aaron counted the descendants of Merari" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The descendants of Merari were counted

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "whom Moses and Aaron counted by their clans" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: counted by their clans

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "by his type of work assignment" or "by the type of work he had assigned each man to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: by the type of work he was assigned to do

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "the curses he has written" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the written curses

contextId.information: This can be written in active form. AT: "if she has defined herself by committing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: if she is defiled because she has committed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "has not defiled herself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: is not defiled

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "vinegar that people make from wine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: vinegar made from wine

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he separates himself to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he is separate to me

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "He must set himself apart to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He must be set apart to Yahweh

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "he has separated himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he is separated

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he has reserved himself for Yahweh" or "set apart for Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: reserved for Yahweh

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "he defiled himself" or "he made himself unacceptable" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: his consecration was defiled

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "fine flour that he mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: fine flour mixed with oil

contextId.information: This means that he had boiled the ram's shoulder. This can be stated in active form. AT: "the shoulder of the ram that he boiled" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the boiled shoulder of the ram

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "that the priest waved" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that was waved

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "fine flour that he had mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: fine flour mixed with oil

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "after Moses had anointed it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: after it was anointed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "They had made the lampstand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The lampstand was made

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "of fine flour that they have mingled with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: of fine flour mingled with oil

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the Levites set up the tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the tabernacle was set up

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the cloud rose up" (UDB) or "Yahweh took up the cloud" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the cloud was taken up

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "the command that Yahweh had given through Moses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh's command given through Moses

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the commands that Yahweh had given through Moses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh's command given through Moses

contextId.information: This can be stated in the active form. AT: "They named that place" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: That place was named

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They named that place" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: That place was named

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "who were some of those whom Moses sent" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who were some of those sent

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that you burn on the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: made by fire

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must do it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It must be done

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that they burn on the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: made by fire

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he must burn an offering on the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he must make an offering made by fire

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the food that the land produces" or "the food that you produce in the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the food produced in the land

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as the decree commands" or "as I commanded when I made the decree" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as commanded by the decree

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will forgive them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: They will be forgiven

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will forgive all the community of the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: all the community of the people of Israel will be forgiven

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will forgive that person when the priest has made atonement" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: That person will be forgiven when atonement has been made

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh had not declared what they should do with him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it had not been declared what should be done with him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must surely put the man to death" or "The man must surely die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The man must surely be put to death

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will set apart that man for himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that man will be set apart to Yahweh

contextId.information: Here "them" refers to the censers. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Let Eleazar make them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Let them be made

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that the men whom the fire had burned up had used" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that had been used by the men who were burned up

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom Moses selected from each of the ancestor's tribes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: selected from each of the ancestral tribes

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "all sins that anyone commits against the sanctuary" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: all sins committed against the sanctuary

contextId.information: Here "given" to God represents being set apart to serve God. This can be stated in active form. AT: "which I have set apart for myself" or "and I have set them apart for myself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: given to me

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that you do not completely burn on the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: kept from the fire

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The people must buy them back when they become one month old" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Those that are to be bought back by the people must be bought back after becoming one month old

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that the people of Israel give to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that have been given to you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "someone whom someone else has killed with a sword" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: someone who has been killed with a sword

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People called this place" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: This place was called

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They called that place Hormah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: That place was called Hormah

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Let someone rebuild and establish again the city of Sihon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Let the city of Sihon be rebuilt and established again

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "We have devastated Heshbon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Heshbon is devastated

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "all of his people were dead" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: none of his people were left alive

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I know you have the power to bless or to curse people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I know that whomever you bless will be blessed, and whomever you curse will be cursed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "because I have blessed them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: because they have been blessed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God gave him this prophecy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He received this prophecy

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The Israelites will occupy Edom" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Edom will become a possession of Israel

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must divide the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The land must be divided

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must divide the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the land must be divided

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you will divide it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it will be divided

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom Moses and Eleazar the priest counted" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who were counted by Moses and Eleazar the priest

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom Moses and Aaron the priest had counted" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who had been counted by Moses and Aaron the priest

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "be a law that all the people of Israel must obey" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: be a law established by decree for the people of Israel

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the food offerings that you will burn on the altar produce" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the food of my offerings made by fire to produce

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. "the burnt offering" or "the offering you have burned by fire on the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the offering made by fire

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that Yahweh commanded at Mount Sinai" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that was commanded at Mount Sinai

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: mixed with oil

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must offer one male goat to Yahweh as a sin offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: One male goat as a sin offering to Yahweh must be offered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. "you must have a feast" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: a feast is to be held

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must burn an offering on the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you must offer a sacrifice made by fire, a burnt offering

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "which Yahweh requires each morning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: required each morning

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must burn the food offering on the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the food of the offering made by fire

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must offer it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It must be offered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: mixed with oil

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "an offering you burnt on the altar to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: an offering made by fire to Yahweh

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: mixed with oil

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: mixed with oil

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as Yahweh commanded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as were commanded

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as Yahweh commanded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as were commanded

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as Yahweh commanded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as were commanded

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as Yahweh commanded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as were commanded

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as Yahweh commanded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as were commanded

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must burn it on the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: an offering made by fire

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "a woman who has been divorced by a man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: a divorced woman

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "A woman's husband may confirm or cancel any vow or oath she has taken that binds her to deny herself something" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Every vow or oath ... may be confirmed or canceled by her husband

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "every tribe sent 1,000 men to war" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: one thousand were provided from every tribe for war

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "everything that someone has made of animal hide, goats' hair, or wood" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: everything made of animal hide and goats' hair, and everything made of wood

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Count all of the possessions that the soldiers took" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Count all the plundered things that were taken

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Collect a tax from the soldiers' plunder and give it to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Then levy a tax to be given to me from the soldiers who went out to battle

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "which he will present to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to be presented to me

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "to be an offering to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to be an offering presented to Yahweh

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he destroyed all the generation ... sight" or "all the generation ... sight had died" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: all the generation ... sight was destroyed

contextId.information: Here the word "land" refers to the people who live there. This can be stated in active form. AT: "if Yahweh subdues before you the people living in the land" or "if they help you subdue the people living in the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: if the land is subdued before you

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "people later changed the names of these cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: their names were later changed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as Yahweh commanded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as commanded by Yahweh

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "so that no one will kill the accused man before the community is able to judge him in court" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so that the accused man will not be killed without first standing trial before the community

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must certainly execute him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: He must certainly be put to death

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "someone must execute the murderer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the murderer must be killed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "according to the testimony of witnesses" or "as witnesses testify to the murder" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as testified to by the words of witnesses

contextId.information: The testimony of one witness is not enough to execute a person for murder. This can be stated in active form. AT: "But the word of only one witness is not enough for you to execute a person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: But one witness' word alone may not cause any person to be put to death

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must execute him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: He must certainly be put to death

contextId.information: This refers to when a person intentionally kills another person. This can be stated in active form. AT: "When someone has shed blood in the land, only the execution of the murderer can make atonement for the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: No atonement can be made for the land when blood has been shed on it, except by the blood of the one who shed it

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "will no longer belong to our ancestor's share" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: will be removed from our ancestor's share

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "it will no longer be a part of our inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it will be removed from the assigned share of our inheritance

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they will take our tribe's share of the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: their share will be taken away from the share of our ancestors' tribe

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Let them marry whom they want" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Let them be married to whom they think best
